intro: Heterotheca fulcrata var. arizonica, commonly known as Arizona tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that attract pollinators. Its structure and adaptations reflect its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
